name: Count CHOP
description: The Count CHOP counts the number of times a channel crosses a trigger or release threshold. It operates in either static or realtime ("Cook to Current Frame") mode.
summary: The Count CHOP counts the number of times a channel crosses a trigger or release threshold. It operates in either static or realtime ("Cook to Current Frame") mode.

parameters.name: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.label: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Count  counts the number of times a channel crosses a trigger or release threshold. It operates in either static or realtime (" to Current ") mode.		
The trigger value by default is 0, so the count occurs when the input goes from below (or equal to) 0 to a value that is greater than zero.			
Crossing the trigger threshold (increasing past the trigger level) creates a trigger event. Similarly, crossing the release threshold (decreasing past the release level) creates a release event. Operations may also be performed while the input remain above or below the trigger or release levels. On each event, the count may be increased or decreased by 1 or the time, or reset to zero. The time per sample varies with the sample rate (i.e. for 100 samples/second, the time for each sample would be 1/100th of a second).			
The optional second input is a reset input. The first channel is interpreted as a channel containing reset pulses. Whenever this channel is non-zero, the count for all channels is reset.			
The third input is labeled "Increment Value". It allows you to specify a value other than the default +-1 to count. If you want to count by Fives, then put a channel with a value of 5 in this input. It will increment by 5 each count, or by 5 per second depending on the On / Off menus on the second page.
countCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  threshold - If on, the trigger threshold is also used as the release threshold.


		
  threshup - The channel level that must be exceeded in order to trigger a count.


		
  threshdown - A release count is triggered when the channel level drops below this threshold.


		
  retrigger - The amount of time after a trigger point that a new trigger may occur.


		
  retriggerunit - 


		
  triggeron -  - Determines whether a trigger occurs on an increasing slope or decreasing slope when passing the trigger threshold. A release will occur on the opposite slope.

 increase - decrease -



  output -  - Select limit options such as loop and/or clamp from the menu. The value will remain in the range from Min to Max.

 off - No limits. loop - Will cycle in a loop between the values given by Limit Minimum / Maximum. min - Clamp will hold the count value at the maximum/minimum value if it goes above or below the limits. lc - Will loop the count back between the limits by shifting the count to the maximum limit. cl - Will loop the count back between the limits by shifting the count to the minimum limit.
		
  limitmin - The minimum allowed count number.


		
  limitmax - The maximum allowed count number.


		
  offtoon -  - The operation to perform when a trigger event (off to on) occurs.

 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -
		
  on -  - The operation to perform while the input remains triggered (on).

 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -
		
  ontooff -  - The operation to perform when a release event (on to off) occurs.

 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -
		
  off -  - The operation to perform while the input is not triggered (off).	
Note: The scripts are run relative to the parent node of this , as if the script is in the node above this .


 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -
		
  resetcondition -  - This menu determines how the Reset input triggers a reset of the channel(s).

 offtoon - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes off to on. on - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes on. The channel will hold the reset value until the input turns off. ontooff - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes on to off. off - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes off. The channel will hold the reset value until the input turns on.
		
  resetvalue - The channel(s) is set to this value when reset.


		
  reset - When On resets the channel(s) to the Reset Value. The Count  will only begin counting again when Reset is Off.


		
  resetpulse - Instantly resets the channel(s) to the Reset Value.





  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -
 -
 -

Extra Information for the Count  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2022.241402021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



To re-compute the output data of the Operators. An operator cooks when (1) its inputs change, (2) its Parameters change, (3) when the timeline moves forward in some cases, or (4) Scripting commands are run on the node. When the operator is a Panel Component, it also cooks when a user interacts with it. When an operator cooks, it usually causes operators connected to its output to re-cook. When TouchDesigner draws the screen, it re-cooks all the Dependencies - the necessary operators in all Networks, contributing to a frame's total "cook time".



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



To "pulse" a parameter is to send it a signal from (1) an exported CHOP channel or (2) a python command or (3) a mouse click that causes a new action to occur immediately. A pulse via python is via the .pulse() function on a pulse-type parameter, such as Reset parameter in a Speed CHOP. A pulse from a CHOP is typically a 0 to 1 to 0 signal in an exported channel.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Count_CHOP&oldid=27592"
		Category: CHOPs

A pulse via python is via the .pulse() function on a pulse-type parameter, such as Reset parameter in a Speed CHOP. A pulse from a CHOP is typically a 0 to 1 to 0 signal in an exported channel.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Count_CHOP&oldid=27592"

parameters.name: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.label: Release = Trigger Threshold
parameters.description: threshold - If on, the trigger threshold is also used as the release threshold.

parameters.name: Trigger Threshold
parameters.label: Trigger Threshold
parameters.description: threshup - The channel level that must be exceeded in order to trigger a count.

parameters.name: Release Threshold
parameters.label: Release Threshold
parameters.description: threshdown - A release count is triggered when the channel level drops below this threshold.

parameters.name: Re-Trigger Delay
parameters.label: Re-Trigger Delay
parameters.description: retrigger - The amount of time after a trigger point that a new trigger may occur.

parameters.name: Re-Trigger Delay Unit
parameters.label: Re-Trigger Delay Unit
parameters.description: retriggerunit -

parameters.name: Trigger On
parameters.label: Trigger On
parameters.description:
triggeron -  - Determines whether a trigger occurs on an increasing slope or decreasing slope when passing the trigger threshold. A release will occur on the opposite slope.

 increase - decrease -

parameters.name: Increasing Values
parameters.label: Increasing Values
parameters.description: increase - decrease -

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.label: Limit
parameters.description:
output -  - Select limit options such as loop and/or clamp from the menu. The value will remain in the range from Min to Max.

 off - No limits. loop - Will cycle in a loop between the values given by Limit Minimum / Maximum. min - Clamp will hold the count value at the maximum/minimum value if it goes above or below the limits. lc - Will loop the count back between the limits by shifting the count to the maximum limit. cl - Will loop the count back between the limits by shifting the count to the minimum limit.

parameters.name: Off
parameters.label: Off
parameters.description: off - No limits. loop - Will cycle in a loop between the values given by Limit Minimum / Maximum. min - Clamp will hold the count value at the maximum/minimum value if it goes above or below the limits. lc - Will loop the count back between the limits by shifting the count to the maximum limit. cl - Will loop the count back between the limits by shifting the count to the minimum limit.

parameters.name: Limit Minimum
parameters.label: Limit Minimum
parameters.description: limitmin - The minimum allowed count number.

parameters.name: Limit Maximum
parameters.label: Limit Maximum
parameters.description: limitmax - The maximum allowed count number.

parameters.name: Off to On
parameters.label: Off to On
parameters.description:
offtoon -  - The operation to perform when a trigger event (off to on) occurs.

 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: None
parameters.label: None
parameters.description: none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: While On
parameters.label: While On
parameters.description:
on -  - The operation to perform while the input remains triggered (on).

 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: None
parameters.label: None
parameters.description: none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: On to Off
parameters.label: On to Off
parameters.description:
ontooff -  - The operation to perform when a release event (on to off) occurs.

 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: None
parameters.label: None
parameters.description: none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.label: While Off
parameters.description:
off -  - The operation to perform while the input is not triggered (off).	
Note: The scripts are run relative to the parent node of this , as if the script is in the node above this .


 none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: None
parameters.label: None
parameters.description: none - inc - dec - inctime - dectime - reset -

parameters.name: Reset Condition
parameters.label: Reset Condition
parameters.description:
resetcondition -  - This menu determines how the Reset input triggers a reset of the channel(s).

 offtoon - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes off to on. on - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes on. The channel will hold the reset value until the input turns off. ontooff - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes on to off. off - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes off. The channel will hold the reset value until the input turns on.

parameters.name: Off to On
parameters.label: Off to On
parameters.description: offtoon - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes off to on. on - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes on. The channel will hold the reset value until the input turns off. ontooff - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes on to off. off - Channels are reset when the Reset input goes off. The channel will hold the reset value until the input turns on.

parameters.name: Reset Value
parameters.label: Reset Value
parameters.description: resetvalue - The channel(s) is set to this value when reset.

parameters.name: Reset
parameters.label: Reset
parameters.description: reset - When On resets the channel(s) to the Reset Value. The Count  will only begin counting again when Reset is Off.

parameters.name: Reset Pulse
parameters.label: Reset Pulse
parameters.description: resetpulse - Instantly resets the channel(s) to the Reset Value.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
